definition: to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance

sentences.english: The water gurgled as it ran down the plug-hole.
sentences.chinese: 水從塞孔中流下時汩汩做聲。
小孩子嗬嗬做聲表示稱心滿意。

sentences.english: Jem decided there was no point in quibbling and was silent.
sentences.chinese: 傑姆覺得跟他磨嘴皮子沒意思，於是便不再做聲了。

sentences.english: The little girl was awed into silence.
sentences.chinese: 那小女孩被嚇得不敢做聲了。
我們雙腳嘎吱做聲地踩着碎石子。

sentences.english: The judge charged her to be silent.
Mahone considers turning in Michael, but says nothing.
sentences.chinese: 馬宏考慮是否招供出邁可來，但是沒有做聲。

sentences.english: She knew what he meant, of course, but just smiled, did not speak.
sentences.chinese: 格溫當然明白他的意思，但只是嫣然一笑，沒有做聲。

sentences.english: The headmaster required her to keep silent.
And many rebuked him, telling him to be silent.
sentences.chinese: 有許多人責備他，不許他做聲。

sentences.english: Too the madam didn't speak, but the eye bottom is hesitant to twinkle.
sentences.chinese: 太夫人沒有做聲，眼底卻有猶豫閃動。

sentences.english: Huck was silent while he framed a duly cautious reply.
sentences.chinese: 哈克沒有做聲，心裏卻在編出一個相當小心的回答。

sentences.english: Over the side, he honestly sat in a corner without saying a word.
sentences.chinese: 他上船後，老老實實坐在一個角落裏，不再做聲。
